sections.title: Consultative accounting for restaurants, delivery and food operations
paragraphs: Restaurants and food businesses face specific challenges: COGS, waste, frequent purchasing, price volatility, inventory control, delivery platform fees and payment costs, plus intensive payroll routines. Without reliable numbers, margins disappear — and cash flow feels it first.

Malaquias structures food service accounting with a focus on control and results. We integrate tax, accounting and finance to organize processes, reduce risks and deliver reports that support pricing, cost control and better decisions to improve profitability.

sections.title: Scale safely: new locations, franchises and units with governance
paragraphs: Scaling a restaurant or food operation requires standardization and control: multiple units, menus, purchasing, staff, inventory and platform payouts. Without accounting and tax structure, expansion can create liabilities, inconsistencies and margin loss due to weak governance.

We support your business with tax planning, corporate structuring and management routines to scale with predictability. The goal is to grow without losing control, with compliance and clear performance by unit.

questions.question: Why does restaurant accounting need to be specialized?
questions.answer: Because the sector has specifics like COGS, inventory control, delivery and payment fees, intensive payroll routines and cost volatility. Specialized accounting helps protect margins and reduce risks.

questions.question: Can you support COGS control and KPIs?
questions.answer: Yes. We structure cost centers and management reports to track COGS, margins, expenses, inventory turnover and performance by unit/channel.

questions.question: How do you organize delivery sales and platform payouts?
questions.answer: We support reconciliation of sales, fees, payouts, refunds and cancellations so finance and accounting match reality.

questions.question: Can we reduce taxes without increasing compliance risk?
questions.answer: Yes. With tax planning, correct regime, review of calculations and compliance, you can pay what’s due and avoid overpayment.

questions.question: Do you support multi-unit operations?
questions.answer: Yes. We support groups and networks with standardized routines, unit-level reports and corporate structuring for expansion.
